name: The Best of Barry Allen Multiple Choice Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Barry served as best man at whose wedding?
questions.explanation:
Elongated Man's.

	Elongated Man and Barry both originally operated out of Central City, allowing them to team up a number of times. Elongated Man enjoyed a long marriage to his wife, Sue.

questions.text: Barry's longtime girlfriend was Iris West. What century is she from?
questions.explanation:
30th.

	Iris was sent back in time as a child and was adopted. She later appeared to die at the hands of the villainous Professor Zoom, but her soul was transported into the 30th century as her body was destroyed.

questions.text: In "JLA: Year One", Barry kisses which superheroine?
questions.explanation:
Black Canary.

	Although both characters acknowledge their attraction to one another, they decline to explore it any further than that kiss. Barry feels that Iris was his one true love.

questions.text: How does Iris originally learn of Barry's secret identity?
options: He was unmasked on cable television
He was revealed in a tabloid
questions.explanation:
Barry talked in his sleep.

	After the two are wed, Iris learned of Barry's alter ego by listening to his nighttime ramblings. He later revealed his secret to her willingly.

questions.text: Barry killed Professor Zoom by breaking his neck.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Professor Zoom seemingly murdered Iris, Barry's wife, and was trying to do it again when Barry began getting involved with another woman. Barry was put on trial for this murder, but was acquitted.

Cobalt Blue.

	Raised by the uncaring Thawne family, young Malcolm became jealous of Barry upon learning of their relationship. He became the villain known as Cobalt Blue and was defeated by both Barry and Wally West, the third Flash.

questions.text: When did Barry Allen make his first appearance?
questions.explanation:
1956.

	Barry first appeared in the fourth issue of "Showcase", dated October 1956. This is recognized by comic book fans as the start of the Silver Age of comic books.

questions.text: Who was Barry's favorite hero as a child?
questions.explanation:
Jay Garrick.

	Barry adopted "The Flash" as his superheroic moniker, modelling himself after his hero Jay Garrick, the first Flash from an alternate universe than came to be known as Earth-Two.

questions.text: Barry invented the cosmic treadmill, a device that enabled very precise time travel.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The treadmill was instrumental in many storylines, including one which sent DC writer Elliot S. Maggin into the very worlds he helped to create!

questions.text: In "The Dark Knight Strikes Again", Allen is used to provide energy for which section of the United States?
questions.explanation:
The East Coast.

	Lex Luthor hooked Barry up to a machine and used the energy from Barry's motion to power the East Coast. Barry eventually escapes and joins Batman in his quest to restore order.
